newsitem.title: MONACO: SOCCER-SCOTLAND HELD TO GOALLESS DRAW IN ESTONIA "REPLAY".
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SCOTLAND HELD TO GOALLESS DRAW IN ESTONIA "REPLAY".

text.p: Estonia turned up on Tuesday and took a point from Scotland in their World Cup qualifier.
The European group four qualifier was a replay of a game scrapped last year when the Estonians failed to turn up.
The Scots attacked for much of the game but scorned a number of chances in the goalless draw. When they were on target they found Estonian goalkeeper Mart Poom in inspired form.
Celtic defender Tom Boyd came closest to breaking the deadlock when he hit the bar in the first half.
The match was played in Monaco after a row about the floodlighting for the original match in Tallinn last October meant the Estonian team failed to turn up at a revised kick-off time.
Scotland were originally awarded a 3-0 victory but Estonia appealed, securing the replay.
